  • Meetings

    Useful links from past meetings

    Townsville R coders club

    We meet every Monday at 11am for an hour to discuss all things R

    Past presentations

    We have some useful resources from our previous site. Below you can find links to some useful or interesting resources from the previous meetings.

    • 15 June 2020. Ira (@iracooke) took us through some best practices for writing performant R and how to use a profiler to optimise code. Ira‚Äôs notes can be found in this repo.

    • 8 June 2020. Kevin Bairos-Novak (@ecolology) gave an intro to build Shiny apps in R. Kevin‚Äôs note can be found in this repo.

    • 25 May 2020. Pete (@pete_cowman) gives an intro and demo to plotting phylogenetic trees in R with the package ggtree. After intro he has fun plotting a phylogeny of butterflyfishes. To view Pete‚Äôs materials on tidyverse see here.

    • 18 May 2020. Joseph M. introduced the issues around Data storage and reproducibility. Started a conversation on producing guidelines and templates for reproducible research. Summary notes

    • 11 May 2020. Ira (@iracooke) summarised the key ideas on random vs fixed effects from the previous meeting, and Sonja walked us through her modelling and model selection approach when modelling fetal renal parenchymal thickness during pregnancy. A rough summary of key concepts and ideas can be found here

    • 27 Apr 2020. Chlo√´ (@CGBoote) lead us through a tutorial on linear mixed models in R. Lorenzo (@ItsFrogday) has summarised the discussion that followed here.

    • 20 Apr 2020. Lindsay (@lindsaymarkward) presented a talk via Zoom on clean code best practices with examples in Python. Link to recording and password: 4S=k@T$H

    • 24 Feb 2020. Anything goes session on loops. #Link to examples

    • 16 Dec 2019. Wytamma (@wytamma) presented a talk on Python basics üêç. We used Google colab to write and run some Python.

    • 2 Dec 2019. Pete (@PeteCowman) presented a talk on using tidyverse to manipulate your data. To view Pete‚Äôs materials on tidyverse see here.

    • 25 Nov 2019. Cesar (@CexyNature) presented a talk on how to use Github. Chlo√´ (@BooteCG), as a way to use his instruction tried to make an .md with the notes/instructions in and posted to her github here

    • 18 Nov 2019. Ira (@iracooke) presented an intro to RMarkdown. The rendered presentation can be viewed on RPubs and source code is on github at https://github.com/iracooke/rmarkdown_intro
